subject: Re: Test naming conventions (was Re: [junit] Unit Testing question)
msgSnippet: Cédric, ... For those of us who aren t JDK 1.5- or TestNG-enabled, there s also Plain Old Javadoc comments. Unfortunately, now that we ve moved to Maven 1.x,
messageBody:
Cédric,

> Sounds like you would benefit greatly from TestNG's "description" attribute:
>
> @ExpectedExceptions(ElementNotFoundException.class)
> @Test(description = "Verify that we throw an exception if the element is not
> in the array")
> public void shouldThrowAnExceptionIfNotPresent(int[] array, int element) {
> ...
> }
>
> These descriptions are then carried over into the HTML reports.
>
> More details: http://tinyurl.com/f7vp2

For those of us who aren't JDK 1.5- or TestNG-enabled, there's also
Plain Old Javadoc comments. Unfortunately, now that we've moved to Maven
1.x, Javadocs are no longer produced for test classes. Maven gives us a
Javadoc-like test cross-reference, but it inexplicably doesn't include
the Javadoc comments.
